review: After previously eating at the Red Robin location in South Plainfield multiple times, I do like the way they arranged everything at this local location. Appetizers: onion stack, pretzel bites with beer cheese are both  a great way to start your beginning eats. Burgers, too, where awesome. Although, the only complaint (1 star loss) was the queso dip--it came out room temperature, which, for a cheese dip should be warm if not hot. Overall, great burger spot around the brick/toms river area.  P.S. if you are a Bacon connoisseur, you must try the Bacon 'aoili' dip. It is delicious.

I will say our waitress was good. I don't remember her name, but she was pulling a double and on the second half of it and she was still going strong. Give her a raise. Other than that, this place still has a lot of kinks to work out. I was in a party of two and there was a 5 - 10 minute wait. They never took my name, just "party of two". This proved problematic seeing as everyone that was a party of two who came in after us thought it was their turn to be seated. Needless to say, FOUR parties of two that came in after us were seated prior to us. One couple was seated immediately after we'd been waiting 20 minutes. Finally a girl came to seat us and then had to take us back to the lobby because the table hadn't been cleared. While waiting for her, yet another party of two that came in after was seated. After another 5 minutes or so, we were about to leave, but the lady finally came back for us.  Food was mediocre at best. Had to ask for utensils. At least the margarita was good. Won't be going back

Ha,  a place that specializes in burgers and you can only order them two ways: #1 "little bit of pink" or  #2 "no pink".  Now I understand why these chains have avoided the northeast for so long.  I ordered the "little bit of pink" and there was no pink at all.  Now for me, I can eat burgers medium rare through medium well but I can imagine how disappointed people will be who must have medium rare or medium burgers.  The burger itself was quality meat, but it's well done so it loses most of the flavor.  The burgers are very expensive which is another drawback especially since you can't get it cooked medium or less.  We sat at the bar which is very small and the beer selections are typical and boring.  Two burgers and three craft beers came to $50, $60 after tip.  The service was fine.  This is a place you come to once just to satisfy your curiosity.  Especially, since five guys and smash burger are both right there in the area and offer superior burgers for $4 less per burger.   Sing it with me...."Red Robin.......buuummmmm (er)".

These people leaving bad reviews after 1 time is laughable especially for a place that just opened.  Red robin is amazing and this one in particular is awesome.  The waiting staff is unbelievable, the food is amazing just a like every red robin. So happy one finally opened ten miles away from me. Will be going back A LOT

This review comes after our second visit to this location. We have been to Red Robin before elsewhere. I didn't post a review after the first visit because our experience was pretty bad and I wanted to give them another chance. I understood it was their first week open so I figured they had to work out the kinks. Well, after our second visit I'm still not overly impressed with this location. I'm trying hard to be patient with them because we really like their food at the other Red Robins. I'm hoping they eventually catch up to the experiences we have had before. The food wasn't bad but not great. I don't mind some salt but everything here comes loaded with salt. We got the onion rings and boneless wings as an appetizer. The kids got chicken fingers and a corn dog. My wife and I each had burgers. This visit other than the excessive salt, the food wasn't bad. The main issue this time was service. The server kept forgetting things and just had the attitude that she was always doing you a big favor when she came to the table. I just haven't been "in love" with this spot. I really hope they come around. I'm giving them four stars only because I pray they start getting their act together. Give it a shot and see what you think.

I love burgers and never been to a Red Robin before.  The food was pretty good. Service was a little better than decent.  Waitress took a bit longer than I would prefer, and I did order a double burger and received a single.  I will definitely go back. It is a brand new place, so I am sure they will work out some of their issues.
Never been to a Red Robin before but I have to say the burgers are very good and the fries are even better!  Serviice was good also.  I'll be back

Having previously tried and enjoyed Red Robin in other locations, I was excited to find out one was being built within a short ride from home. Our party of four was looking forward to checking this one out, and though they weren't perfect, it was a good experience and we all agreed we would return there in the future. We arrived at about 5:30 and the restaurant was pretty crowded, but we didn't have to wait to be seated, as they had a table for 4 by the bar. By 6pm, our waiter informed us we had gotten there just in time, as the wait time was now 35 minutes. I'm sure the wait times will die down a bit once the novelty of a new restaurant passes, and they probably won't keep as many servers on staff as they seem to have now.  Red Robin is best known for having a variety of "gourmet" burgers, but they do have other types of sandwiches (fish, chicken), soups, salads, and even a few full meals. They have an appetizer menu that is broken down by price - $3, $5, $7, and $9 options. The most intriguing one seems to be the $9 "towering onion rings" which they seemed to be selling a lot of when we were there. We chose to go with the $5 order of tortilla chips, seasoned with sea salt and served with guacamole and salsa. The chips were tasty enough to be eaten plain. The salsa was decent. I didn't try the guac, but my friends said it was good.  I ordered the "Burnin' Love" burger, which is topped with jalapeno-jack cheese, salsa, fried jalapeno slices, lettuce, tomato, and chipotle aioli, and served on a jalapeno-cornmeal bun. A lightly roasted whole jalapeno pepper was fixed to the top of it with a toothpick. Our server, a pleasant and sociable guy named John, dared me to eat the pepper in one bite. I told him I'd do it if he took my meal off the tab. He couldn't, so I didn't. The burger could have been a bit warmer, but it was nicely cooked, and was thick and juicy. One of Red Robin's trademarks is that they offer "endless fries" with the gourmet burgers. These aren't wimpy little stick fries like at Smashburger; they are thick steak fries. I ordered mine regular, but my friend got the parmesan-herb fries, which were excellent. We were expecting them to be really slow bringing out additional servings of fries, but they came out surprisingly quickly and our server did nothing to dissuade us from asking for more.  Red Robin has a full bar, but I can't comment on the drinks, as we pretty much stuck with iced tea and Cokes. One of our party also ordered some kind of shake and said it was delicious.  The wait staff were all nice, and there were plenty of them. There were also at least 3 or 4 hostesses on duty, and a manager came to our table to check on us during the meal. Just watching them all as they went back and forth past our table, it seemed like they may have been a bit disorganized, but this should get better as the employees all learn the Red Robin way of doing things at this new location. Our party's experience was unanimously positive, and we all agreed Red Robin is much better than their sad little neighbor around the corner, Smashburger.

Best Red Robin I have been to. I've been to quite a few on the east coast. Maybe they have the advantage of being new! I've been here a handful of times since they opened a few weeks ago.  99% of the staff is very nice and accommodating. There has been one waitress who was less than friendly, but I shake it off due to the newness and the usual crazy-busy state of the just-opened business.  The food is great - some choices seem a bit bizarre (tavern fries are weird), but generally you know what's coming. I love the Royal Red Robin burger. It's nice that they have easy substitutions options. If you don't want bottomless fries, you can get bottomless broccoli! Definitely recommend this location!

Still a decent to okay burger chain but it's right next to burger city with  Smashburger, BWW, and Quaker Steak & Lube and not even far away from Applebees, Fridays, and Five Guys so if you want a burger you have thousands of options now even though the burger overload will make everything seem meh. The upper hand this place has over Smashburger is that it serves drinks and is a good place to spend a weekend watching the game. Also the fries are a lot better here than next door. Lots of decent and fun options for burgers here but when it comes to taste and quality my vote still goes to Five Guys.

I might never understand the "Burgermania" that seems to be sweeping the area lately, with chains like Smashburger, Five Guys, Burger 25, Cheeburger, and a million others that seem to think the lowly hamburger - an item that used to cost five bucks at any diner, should suddenly become a "gourmet" item.  That said, you'd have to be disconnected from the TV / radio entirely to have never heard of Red Robin. In case you're one of those people, Red Robin is (you guessed it), another burger restaurant, specializing in "gourmet" hamburgers, shakes, and endless french fries.  The menu is pretty expansive, and no matter what you're in the mood for, they probably have a burger for it, be it spicy, savory, sweet, or even one with an egg on top, which actually tastes pretty good.  A leg up that this place has over "fast casual" chains like Five Guys and the (in my opinion, awful) Smashburger, is that you can get a beer with your meal.  While the tap list isn't exactly anything special, and mostly consists of AB Inbev macrobrew stuff like Budweiser and "macro-craft" breweries, it's still nice to have the option.  Decor for the place?  Ehh, it's pretty much your typical kitschy chain restaurant akin to TGI Fridays, with knick-knacks and posters all over the walls and ceilings.  A little more tastefully done, perhaps. Speaking of taste - on to the important thing, the food.  RR only cooks burgers two ways, apparently.  You can either get "a little bit of pink", or "no pink".  I've tried getting it as rare as possible by practically begging, and of the 3 times I've been here, the burgers have always come out hockey puck'ed, aka, well done / "no pink".  If you're going to ask me how I want it, could you at least *try* not to grill the thing until it's burnt?  Most of the juices were gone at that point, kinda sad, since the burgers themselves are of decent quality, and flavor is pretty good.  The topping combinations all work pretty well, and the fries are pretty great, especially when combined with one of their dipping sauces (I'm a fan of campfire).  Prices are the upper end of average, and most burgers are ~$8 to $12. As other people have said, this place still has a bunch of kinks to work out.  Service is friendly, but has been pretty spotty.  Waitstaff seem to be either overworked, mismanaged, or understaffed, since they're constantly buzzing around from table to table.  Food sometimes comes out quickly, other times it's an eternity, and while they haven't really ever screwed up my order, there has been a few times where they forgot to bring a sauce, and my burgers have *always* come out well done, no matter how I ordered it.  Hopefully they work these things out, since the food here is better than anything you'll get at Five Guys, and *WAY* better than the SmashBurger that's next door. 3/26/15 *Quick edit, dropping a star since they've only gotten worse. An HOUR for a hamburger on a Wed night, and burnt AGAIN?  Gonna be a long time before I go back.  Staff is nice, but the kitchen is incompetent.*

Went for lunch on a Sunday. While it was crowded, it was not packed. Waited 20 minutes before a waitress even came over (only after I went to hostess to complain). Took an hour and 10 minutes to get 2 hamburgers and 2 kid meals. Waitress was atrocious. Manager went to another table to apologize because they lost their ticket. Food was nothing special, kids meal could not have been smaller and any kid over 3 it won't be enough for (2 small chicken fingers).I have had better $5 bar burgers then these $12 ones. Will never go back.

Food was terrible. Yes OK it looks nice. The meet has no flavor at all. Had to have my order corrected three times. The wait staff was very uninttentive . the waitresses where to busy talking between each other. I had to ask several times for a refill on my drink. After words I asked for there general manager. That I was told was busy. So then I asked for the kitchen manager who was not there. So I finely got the front of house manager. When I asked why there cooks were not wearing hats hair nets and beard guards. Just looked confused. Ohh hats parents OK. I replayed what good is a hat if the woman in the back just have there hair out the back. Why are the men with full beards not wearing beard guards. This manager really told me I don't know. Very disappointed in everything there

I've never written a review before on any restaurant because frankly I just don't care, but hands down worse service I've ever received. If you take togo orders shouldn't there be someone by the phone at all times? We called at least 6 times in a row until finally someone picked up but to just be placed on hold again. The ordering was a little awkward. Me " Can I please get that burger well done " Togo " so you want a little pink " Me " no, no pink"....from there we went to pick it up. (Lady with the Ipad) eyes roll up no hi. Me " I'm picking up a to go order" IPad lady points to bar no smile "pick up is over there" .....anyway there was more but I'm not going to get to into it. I really had high hopes for this place but it was a let down. Don't recommend Togo food, wasn't that great.

Nice place, had Banzi Wings w/ Yukon Chips, and pretzel bites, they were GREAT! Also had the Whiskey River burger, it was ok, but I've been eating burgers forever, all over the country, everything from free menu burgers to $75 REAL Kobe burgers, in snooty upscale French restaurants for lunch. I'd go back again, but for other menu items...Service was great, hostess to waitress, and it starts getting crowded at Noon, so get their early for a seat on weekends...

Omg get the southern bacon gourmet burger it's amazing! The combination of candied bacon and BBQ sauce is to die for then I got it on their jalopeano corn bread as my bread for the burger wow! Me and my boyfriend sat at the bar and Erica was our bartender she gave us an amazing experience and treated us so well! Get the Oreo milkshake and spike it! You deserve it

I have no idea how the food is, because both times I tried to place a take out order, I sat on the phone for OVER 15 minutes. The second time I was waiting for a manager to take the call since the person who answered never got back on the phone. Apparently the manager can't be bothered to take a call either.  Never had a problem placing a take out order with any other restaurant before. wow, get it together people.

So I have been to several Red Robin's and this is the worst overall. I went there friday around 10pm, which is a hour before they close. I sat at the bar where there was only 3 other customers that were eating. There was 2 bartenders at the bar talking to the other customers and among themselves. I sat there thinking if they do not notice me within 5 minutes I was going to leave. Just as I looked at my phone and realized 5 minutes has passed and I was about to leave, the bartender approaches me and asked what I would like. So I decided to give it a try, BAD MISTAKE. I ordered the Fiery Ghost Tavern Burger which he did not ask me how I wanted it cooked. I also ordered a Jack and Coke, which was the weakest and worst Jack and Coke I have ever had. Should have just been called a $6 Coke. I also ordered a Coke afterwards, and for the first time I was charged for a soft drink after having a alcoholic beverage. While I was drinking my Coke, The bartender Andrew was cleaning something for the milkshake and it exploded on me, and got all over the left side of my shirt. All he kept saying is that never happened before, but nobody wanted to compensate me for what just happened. He later asked if I wanted to speak to the manager, I said yes. The manager comes over and  offers to reimburse me if I get my shirt dry cleaned. This was terrible customer service, and having the same type of service come from the manager shows this location is not customer service orientated. I liked the burger, did not like the fries, hated the Jack and Coke, and hated the customer service. I may go back to Red Robin, but definitely not going back to this one.

If I could give 0 stars I would. Took an hour and 15 minutes for 2 burgers. Our waitress never put our order in. The tables around us were seated after us, got their burgers and left before we even saw our burgers. Finally when we got our burgers they were soggy, and disgusting. She did comp us for her mistake,  2 drinks and a $3 appetizer. Will avoid this place at all cost.

This was our first time at a Red Robin. Was a little skeptical considering the reviews. The service was a bit slow. Took about ten minutes for a waitress to come to our table once we were seated. Food was good and came out in a timely fashion however the meal came before we were done with our appetizer. This place did not wow me but did like that you could substitute fries for salad. For the fact that this was a "burger and brews" my husband was expecting a larger selection of craft beers...they didn't even have Miller Lite on draft. Would dine here again.

I'm a tough customer when it comes to restaurants. Growing up around good quality dives and chains I tend to have higher standards than many of my dinning companions here on the Jersey Shore (see my other reviews). So, when I see reviewers say that Red Robin is located next to Smashburger, BWW, or AppleBee's and that makes too much competition for them...I laugh.  I've been to Red Robin three times since they've opened, with three different groups of people, for three different types of outings. I went there with co-workers as an after work group get-together. I went with my kids as an after movie lunch, and I went with my husband on date night. Not once did anyone have left-overs to take home or even have food left on their plate. My co-workers think BWW is the bomb (gross), my son think's AppleBee's is awesome (also gross), and it's not uncommon for me to make separate meals for my husband because we don't like the same food. So, to get such a diverse group of people ranging from 15-47 years old to enjoy the same place is a score. And everyone enjoyed it! All three times our food was cooked to order and everyone liked their meal. They have free refills on fries (though I would ask for them to not season them or season them lightly - it doesn't take much for them to be heavy handed with the fry seasoning and there's a bottle on the table so you can always season them yourselves). And free refills on many of the drinks. Their shakes were good, their cocktails reasonably priced, and their meal selection is huge. No one had a complaint and ALL my daughter does is complain - especially at restaurants.  The staff is always friendly - the only downside is that there is often a wait of 45 min. The place gets packed - which should be an indicator of how good it is given that as previous reviewers have mentioned, Red Robin is situated next to a Quaker Steak, Smashburger, Atlanta Bread, Joe's Crab Shack, Outback, AppleBee's and BWW...there are no shortages of places to eat in that parking lot or the adjoining parking lot. With that many places to chose from if the food wasn't that good people wouldn't wait. Especially since many of them are similarly priced and sell burgers and drinks. It's worth a try - I don't think you will be disappointed!!

Great burgers, bottomless fries,  Yummmm. I always enjoy Red Robin and this one is a newer location and the new design had a more grown up and sophisticated look.  The staff was polite and this was an enjoyable dinner worth good friends.

This Red Robin has managed to disappoint me in a way I'm not used to. I expect a chain restaurant to have middling-to-good food, reasonably good service, and fair prices. Red Robin in Brick has good food made consistently wrong, friendly staff but not enough of them, and surprisingly high prices for a simple food. I've been to this location four times. Not once has my burger been cooked correctly. Now, I understand they won't do anything below medium. They don't even call it medium - they call it "some pink." If you're going to call it "some pink," there should be some pink. I have yet to see pink. To be fair, everything else about the burgers have been fine. They taste good. They're served as advertised. But, c'mon. If burgers are your specialty, and you've been doing burgers for 40 years, you should be able to get "some pink" right at least 1 in 4 times. As for the service, the last time I was here it took an hour from when I was seated, until I had my burger. I know it was an hour because I was texting someone in the lobby as I waited, so I could see when I sent my last text. It took 20 minutes before anyone even took our order, and another 40 minutes until our burgers arrived. It shouldn't take an hour to go from Seated to Burgers when the restaurant isn't even half full. The problem isn't the waitstaff, though. In fact our water was awesome. It's management. The restaurant is severely understaffed. I know this not only because it's plain to see, but because the manager on duty also explained to us what was going on when we complained. Get your act together, Red Robin. You have over 500 locations, and you've been in business for over 40 years. I know you know how to staff a restaurant. What are you doing in Brick? It's going to be a few months before I bother going back. I really can't think of a reason to go. The burgers are good, but not worth waiting an hour for. I can get a beer and a burger in half the time at Quaker Steak & Lube or Applebees without even leaving the shopping plaza, or at Friday's across the street.

There was three of us and was told it'll be 40 minutes ended up being 20 (awesome). Had their fries app and was just enough for all of us. The burgers were great, service was great and atmosphere was great. All in all great!!

For 6.00 I would say it's fair  for 12.00 go to Five guys ,get change ,you can't charge 12.00 for a big roll and small burger and condiments ,fair French  fries,they don't compare to five guys, if it's beer your craving find another place to eat I will.

I really don't understand all the negative reviews. I went their on a Saturday night with a couple of friends and yes their was a wait but we were told their would be one because of how busy it was and we were fine with that. The burgers were all cooked to our liking and they filled us up and we had to take some home to go. I would definitely recommend it to a friend. Oh and by far much better than five guys, a better quality burger and fries.

Not bad for a chain. My menu was so sticky, the pages were stuck together. I had the Turkey burger on a gluten free bun. It was good. Our server Juan was very friendly and got everything about our Order correct. Im happy they have gluten free options. My hubby had a burger with lots of bacon and enjoyed it.

I wanted to like this place.  I really did.  They have a great looking menu with tons of choices:  a burger for every taste.  I started with a house salad which was on par and my husband got the Chili Chili Cheese Fries which were fine.  The waitstaff had forgotten about our apps so the fries had been sitting a while, but they were still good.  Right after getting our apps, our burgers came: another sign they forgot to bring our our apps when they were done.  I will say, they did notice we just started so they took them back and brought, what appeared to be, new burgers once we finished our apps.   I went with the Whisky River BBQ burger and my husband went with the Fiery Ghost Pepper Double.  The first thing we both noticed was the woefully sad size of the actual burger on the sandwiches.   I described it as a fast food patty on a restaurant bun.  They were tiny, and dry, and without much flavor.  My husband was disappointed by the lack of spice in his "Fiery" burger and I was completely bummed by the lack of BBQ sauce in my BBQ burger.  I was hard pressed to find any on there and that was the main reason I went for that one.  I got the fries with my burger and they were quite good.  My husband got broccoli along with his burger and was convinced it smelled like fish, which is just odd. Aside from the slight mess up with the apps, the service was good and the waitress was very sweet.  Everyone we dealt with on the staff was pleasant in fact. While the option to go for a burger and beer was enticing, we both decided that we'd be better off bringing a 6 pack to Five Guys over going to Red Robin again.

The only problem we have ever had here, was trying to get sweeteners for iced tea. Most of the time we have to ask 3 different people before either we get them or get some ourselves from another table.

Thank God that someone had the idea of putting a red robin a few miles from where i live. The closest one before that was an hour and a half away! The steak fries are te best thing thats every been in my mouth.

This place has a nice selection of burgers. However, this was my first time there.  Early afternoon when I got there, so no wait. Standard service for a chain. Happy hour is always nice too.  I got a bacon cheeseburger. Medium done with bottomless fries. My cousin had onion rings for a price but only 1 serving. Food arrives at a decent time, cooked to order. Take a bite, hello mediocrity. Same as other chains. I thought they would amp it up some, with 2 other burger joints 5 minutes or less away. Well, they have a lot of sauce options but I don't use those. I want to taste the burger. Which had no lettuce, pickle, tomato, or red onion. (I don't like tomato on mine but wanted to tell you.) Server was pleasant, atmosphere is trendy. Overall, nothing to really draw me in over other chains. Service 93/100 Quality 80/100 Atmosphere 84/100 Overall 86/100

Honestly, anyone that goes to a chain restaurant and expects gourmet food and drinks is the one in the wrong. This is a chain restaurant with corporate policies. For a chain though, this place is pretty good. We had the queso chili dip which was bomb! I had a bacon avocado burger for my entree and it was really good as well. For dessert I had the nana moo moo shake which is bananas and chocolate. It was awesome. Pretty cool how this place has a bar and I hope they make it in brick plaza with all the competition.
This place has the slowest service!!! It is terrible.  I have never waited so long for food in my life

As usual, a restaurant that serves alcohol has food that must only taste good if you're drunk. You also need to be drunk so you don't notice the 20 minutes you need to wait for a server but we hung in there.    Husband and I ordered onion ring and pretzel appetizers. Pretzels were obviously microwaved. Onion rings were okay but probably could have gotten better next door at Smashburger.  For the entrees,  ordered the crab cake "burger" and he ordered clam chowder. After an additional 45-minute wait after apps were cleared, we finally had to ask for the entrees to-go.   When I finally got a look at the "crab cake " I saw it was a flattened, breaded patty. Looked and tasted like a flat fish stick.  Husband said his clam chowder tasted no different than Progresso.  Noisy, ridiculously slow service, and sub-par food.  I'd give it only 1 star but the server was extremely polite and apologetic. We got the impression the long wait times weren't his fault.  Anyway, avoid this yet-another-bad-chain-restaurant.

AWFUL SERVICE! I was seated promptly and then forgot about. We then had a server say they were going to cover for another server and so he took our milkshake order and left. The new server returned with half of the order correct. She fixed it , took our food order, which she then places wrong. A third server brings us some of our food not all. i flag down the second server that placed our food order asking for the rest of my order to which she replied I should have told her I wanted that to begin with because now they have to make it..... But I did. She came back with the rest of my order a while later (the portion was soooooo small!!!) and started to ask us about something but her sentences always trailed off and she would just walk away without finishing her sentences. Honestly I have no idea how she is employed there. oh, have I mentioned that this occurred when the restaurant was dead and there were only maybe five tables and at least that many employees working!? NOT GOING BACK!

I normally take reviews with a grain of salt. The reviews for Red Robin in Brick, however, were spot on.  My husband and I went there for lunch on a Tuesday afternoon. There were a few other customers, I'd say it was about 1/4 full.  We were seated immediately, the hostess was efficient and courteous. No problems there. Our waitress arrived a couple of minutes later at our table for our drink order. Hubby had an iced tea, I had a margarita on the rocks and a glass of water. The margarita was sub-par, clearly not shaken enough before it was poured into the glass (it was slightly warm) and made with what tasted like a cheap mix.  After placing our food order (a whiskey river bbq burger and a royal red robin), we waited. And waited. And waited. I had a clear view of the kitchen and saw 2 dishes sitting in the window for at least 15 minutes. I could tell it wasn't our food, but obviously someone else was waiting for their food for a long time too! Meanwhile, our waitress didn't stop by once to ask if we needed anything else.  Finally, our food arrived. There was nothing "gourmet" about either burger. The egg on the royal red robin was cold and the yolk caved in, like it was sitting for a long time. The bun tasted cheap, like a regular, cheap sesame bun you can buy from any supermarket or convenience store. It disintegrated under the grease. The patty was thin, not much thicker than a McDonalds patty. The bbq burger had fried onion "straws" (more like a pile of limp, greasy onions) that my husband couldn't even bite through, they were so tough. All of the food was slightly warm, at best. The fries weren't bad, I'll give them that. When our waitress came by to see if everything was ok and we said "it was just ok", she came back with dipping sauces for the fries. They weren't too bad. She clearly told her manager that we weren't satisfied. He stopped by and he was very courteous, he listened to what we had to say and was apologetic. He is the reason why we gave the place 2 stars instead of 1.  We're not going back. It's not worth it. Smashburger is next door and has better burgers. There are a ton of other chains in the area that have better food for those prices.

Terrible service! Won't ever go back! My husband and I should have known we were in for a weird time here when the waitress tried to first seat us at the "high" tables in the bar area for dinner. (Even though it was not crowded). How uncomfortable. We were moved to the regular dining area immediately. We didn't ask to sit in the bar.. Anyway, after 10 minutes we got an apology from the server for the wait, he took our burger and drink order. Ok. We ordered two well done burgers and fries. A water and a soda. Nothing special for a burger place. We were excited to try this place out! Well, the Drinks came right out but We needed some napkins, which we had none on the table. As we waited I tried to get the servers attention for a napkin. He would not look in our direction. It was almost comical. I tried to get anyone else's attention too. No one would look at me! So I gave up. For 45 more minutes this went on!! We sat and sat and sat- the server NEVER checked on us or came back to explain the long wait. NOTHING. People in another section across the room ( who were seated after us) got appetizers, burgers, desserts., and were replaced with new customers who got appetizers.. WE WERE STILL NAPKINLESS AND FOODLESS !!  Just as we were about to stand up and just leave , the food arrives. Now We can't start on it because we had no silverware to eat with! ( must be with the napkins!!) The waiter sighed annoyedly to have to get us silverware and then proceeded to serve someone else why we sat waiting AGAIN. We were LIVID  now. Touching the food with our hands and guess what... everything was ICE COLD!! THATS IT! Expecting more problems ( and I was right) I broke open my burger with my finger to check it, and it was RAW MEAT inside!! Not well-done. That was the last straw! When the napkins and silverware finally arrived we were already standing up and leaving. The server didn't seemed surprised and just WALKED AWAY. As if it was common to see!!!! We stopped and told the seater at the podium of our rotten experience and she just said -"do you want a manager?? "My husband said "what will he do at this point ?" She said she didn't know. And we really didn't want to get anyone fired-  but c'mon!!  So We just left , paid for nothing, disgusted and Hungry. We will not be going back!! At least to this location. We never got to try the food so there's no opinion on that. I did take the napkin out with me. I don't know- Somehow that slightly lessened my "feeling abused"!

I want to really like this location because I think the food is really good but the service here is horrible!!. I went on a Thursday around 4 o clock and we waited forever for our food. The waitress came to the table chewing on her food!!  Um disgusting I don't want to see you chewing food while speaking to me. I ordered a basket of fries to come out earlier then the food and it look like it had been sitting out and then refried. I sent them back and the manager with blonde hair just gave me a weird look when I said they were hard. She then asked, "oh you don't want your fries crunchy?" Um I don't think any one does she then bought back another basket of fries that looked exactly the same!. Highly disappointed in the staff here.
Great selection of COLD beer on tap. I've had 4 of their many burgers they offer so far and it's a repeat place for me. Service is great. Red Robin Yum.

We had reviewed the menu online. Looked nice. The food looked great in the pictures. And then we went there... Bring a jacket or a sweater, you're going to be cold. Restaurants tend to be a bit cooler. This one was a little extra cold. Service is slow. Don't expect anyone to check to see how you're doing until you're practically half way out the door. I can't imagine how long you would have to wait for more fries. By the time she came back to check how are dinner was, we were ready to leave. The food was edible. Looked nothing like the pictures in the menu. And was over cooked. The meat was dry and bland.  Better off going to SmashBurger next door.
Rarely a wait when we go here, burgers are great - always something new to try. Solid collection of beer to choose from.

Went there tonight with a friend and waited to be seated which was fine considering it was a Saturday. Then after a twenty minute wait our server Dominque finally came over to take our drink order. Didn't see her again till ordering. Let's start with the appetizers the zucchini sticks were great but the pretzel bits suck not hot the cheese dip wasn't hot. The burgers took a really long time to get to table and the server never really bothered to check up on us to see if we needed anything . I also told her I belong to the club rewards program I started to give her my phone number and again she just walked away and said nothing I guess it was to much trouble.

We were very happy to see  a Red Robbin opening near us. We have visited several of them in other areas and have always been very happy. This location is the exception.  We first visited when they opened and believed the visit wasn't good because it was new. We tried again a few weeks later and there was no improvement. After visiting a few days ago we give up. The servers are just bad, the wait for food is very long and the food itself is not up to the standards of other Red Robbins.

LOVE the onion rings here, so crispy and delicious! The adult milkshakes are fun and tasty. The bottomless fries are great, but I usually can't do more than the amount they serve with the burgers. The burgers are cooked the way I like them and the different options are put together well. I like the classic burger best, but I also recommend the bleu ribbon burger. Not as greasy as other burger places. Can be a little pricey at first, but the rewards system makes it super easy to cash in on free items.

Took my Mom there for lunch on 8/4/15.... Wanted to love the place but have to say if you can't cook burgers the way a customer wants them at a premium price then you really shouldn't be in business... My mom asked for a burger that was medium & it came well done.... Waitress was wonderful & said she wished she could have cooked the burgers or us.... Although fries were good for $30 bucks think I'll stick with smash burger .... Sorry
very simple, burgers are freakin delicious, so are fries.. would prefer to order ahead, and take it home to my clean residence  ORDER ANY BURGER with FRIES and take it home and it is PERFECTLY TASTY.

3rd time at this location, definitely not a charm ~ and there won't be a 4th. I won't bore you with the details of the first two horrible times, chalked it up to a new restaurant opening, etc., but after several months figured I'd give it another chance. I ordered the most expensive "gourmet"  burger on the menu, $14.99, and after waiting 45 minutes (the kids were dying at this point), was served a burger that looked like it had been dropped on the floor, absolutely nothing like the appetizing picture on the menu, waitress agreed on the awful appearance and back it went to the kitchen for a redo. Out comes a new burger, unfortunately at this point I already have a bad taste in my mouth, regardless burger still not good/great. My kids meals were just ok. Spending over $70 for the four of us ( and again the wait for the food was a killer),  I would expect a superior product, but it's just not there, much better options elsewhere . AVOID '
Not too bad, some of our burgers seemed a bit too greasy. Not sure if we are "in love" with the place though. Milkshakes aren't bad either.

I have been frequenting Red Robin in Hamilton for years, so I was excited to head over to this place in Brick since it's so much closer to home. It was just  myself and our two kids this visit, and we had no wait and were seated quickly. It took a little while for our server to come by, and she made no mention of the little iPad looking thing on the table-which was new for me, even though I've been to RR before. Eventually we figured it out after she put our drink orders in. The food came out quickly enough, but our pretzel bites were very overcooked. They looked almost like they were chocolate covered and it was clear they had been in the fryer too long. They still tasted alright, and my kids and I just over dipped them in the beer cheese. (As if you could ever over dip something...) I would have ordered the Uberburger, which was a special, but I was shocked at the sticker price! $14 for a burger? Totally outrageous. The bigger issue was not the price, but the fact that you can't even order the burger how you want it cooked. I get what they are trying to do-making it their "own" by saying "some pink or no pink" but I wound up ordering the Nacho Burger and was told my the waitress my only option was medium well. That was disappointing. When the food came out, my kids were super happy with their meals. The fries looked perfectly cooked, and the burgers were great, albeit small portions for what we paid. Mine tasted fine, and was a good size, but once again, my sweet potato fries were burned. You get an option to leave feedback when you check out-which happens to be at the table. (I liked that part a lot, although being that I saw our waitress about 5 seconds the whole visit, I didn't feel great about the automatic move to a 20% tip..but, I left it anyway.) and I did leave my feedback so they knew that some of our food was overcooked. I signed up for e-mails for specials...sadly, I think that is the only time I would come back.

worst burger and weirdest looking staff ever.  crappy bacon cheeseburger,  inconsistent fries.  waitress said I could only order my burger medium, told the table next to me they could have some pink in it.  I thought I was in an alternative club of some sort;  the staff had too many piercings, (very distraction),  tattoos &  different/odd colored hair!!! I am not against any of that but when the food is that bad things like that stand out.. the newest scam is those I pad like displays.  If you dont know how to use it,  watch out,  the waitress will hover over you & when it automatically shows a 20% tip you end up saying ok..  I have been to the one in Sanford Florida and that was the "BEST BURGER EVER", that's why I came to this one.  The only thing that was good was the beer!!!

Not sure why everyone loves their burgers. Been there a couple of times and every time, the burger was dry and had no flavor to it. And to pay 12 bucks for the frozen patty that they call a gourmet burger?  Nah, I will take Five Guys over this place any day.  Not even sure why I am giving it 2 stars, the fries also came out cold.
It was good tasty burgers onion ring were old school big & crispy waitress was um different. It is what it is chain burger place but did the job. All in all descent

I'm really not sure why there are so many negative reviews, it seems that most of the problems were around the time they were first opened, and have all but stopped now. I had never been to a Red Robin before, but as is for most people, their YUMMM! jingle is engrained in my head, so when I drove past and saw the sign, I decided to try it. Went in Friday night 6 p.m., the wait was 15-20 minutes, about what was expected. My friends and I got sat, and were greeted by a waiter names Nicole nearly immediately, even though she looked swamped with tables. The burgers were cooked to perfection, even with the Some pink, no pink, well done method that they use. Service was fast, the meal and bottomless fries was wonderful, and I would absolutely go back.

Great food great prices ...best burgers around amd the fries just keep on coming i could go on amd on about the burgers ...definitley   favorite places to eat in the area ...if you havnt tried it be sure to stop there

This location is great for a quick meal and a nice cold beer. The service is a little hit or miss when it comes to accuracy and speed. The table ordering system is convenient for ordering appetizers and other items. This system is not good if you need to call your server though. During my last visit I waited a total of 20 minutes for the appetizer to reach the table and the place was completely empty. The server told us that she was in the back office taking care of something and told us a partial life story. She was apologetic which helped to make the visit better. In this case someone should've known to run her food orders which had been sitting in the window for far too long before they reached our table. This place was great when it opened but the overall service seems to have decreased greatly. Hopefully this location improves so I can continue to enjoy my visits here.

I have been a big fan of Red Robin since living in the Denver Colorado area where they are easy to find.. I was so happy when they opened one within a few miles of where I live in Brick. I always feel at home watching a ball game and having a meal in the bar area. They always make sure I am ok with what I need and I am always happy that I went there.

I have to say I love Red Robin, but boy oh boy does this location need a little TLC. We sat by the bar at a high top and the server came by got our drink order then came back with them and pretty much disappeared for a while. Once we ordered and got our food the burger was hot and fresh, but the fries were hard and cold like they had been sitting there from the previous night...GROSS. The waitress didn't come by for a LONG time so I coulnd't even ask for fresh new hot ones. VERY DISAPPOINTED!

Two days after a Snow storm my Hubby & I went in to get out of the house for lunch. Not to many people there. We live up the street. We would go all the way to 130 in Hamilton, NJ for the Burgers to that Red Robin. I was very disappointed in this Red Robin Burger & so was my Husband. I used my 10th free meal coupon on a tasteless burger that took forever to come. Will not be back. Going to take the drive to Hamilton. But the Onion Rings were good & people were nice.
Service was ok but the food, not so much. If you're into typical chain restaurant food that's fried, slathered in sauce, and over priced for the quality, you'll love it.
The service at this place is hit or miss. Of course you can get decent burgers elsewhere. Its just a go to spot if you want quick fried foods or drinks. That's all

I should have listened to the bad reviews. Starting from the beginning, half of our table couldn't hear the waitress bc she basically whispered, she then forgot drinks and straws. The kids meals came out first like we asked but were cold, frigid almost. My husband ordered the chili burger that boasted a heaping pile of their famous chili. It was pathetic. One spoonful of dry, crusty, canned chili. He said it tasted canned. My meal however, never came. When it finally did it was the only decent temperatured one. I got the royal burger (it had an egg and some fancy sauce). It was delicious until about halfway through when it tasted like a shoe. I looked at my burger and it was burnt. I've eaten burnt before but this tasted even weirder, maybe like the grill cleaner? Idk. I tried to keep going bc I was hungry but I just couldn't do it. We then went to the restroom to change my son. I felt awful bc as soon as his diaper came off he peed and soaked the changing table. There weren't any paper towels (I get it , eco friendly) but I couldn't find any toilet paper either. I ended up using ALL of the changing table covers. When I went into the stall the door "locked" but kept flying open. So all in all the whole experience sucked. Sorry, I really liked Red Robin the last time I went (Western NY), but this place was awful.

Love the food (grilled chicken burger w fries and buzzard sauce) but it shouldn't take 45 minutes to make.. And 20 minutes for a water..and another half hours for a refill on fries..me and a friend always come here and before we come we say "ready for bad service but good food" the service here is beyond awful to the point as soon as we get there we order our Food when we sit down otherwise we'll be there for 5 hours.. Also I've worked as a waitress and asking if you need change from a $20 check when the customer gives you $100 is a bit absurd. (Giving 3 stars because I enjoy the food)

Went here with a friend for "National Burger Day". It was my first time ever coming to a Red Robin and I can say it won't be my last. Although it was crowded, the service was great. Our waitress kept checking up on us and kept our drinks filled. The food was delicious... Can't go wrong with a cheese burger and endless fries!

Dinner time was busy and service was very rushed. Food is consistent with what Red Robin offers. My son loves this location because they have the tablet at the table with all the games. It is what it is. It's a chain and so expectations should be tempered. The nice thing was that I could pay through the tablet so I didn't need to wait for the server to get my check. Not too much more to write about so I'll just skip to the end... Shenster approved.

So I've been here a few more times and have to say I doubt I'll be returning. First things first they seem to upsell you without actually telling you there are extra charges. It has happened several times now. In addition there payment system is absolutely ridiculous. You can split the check only if it's 2 cards or 2 people paying cash. You apparently are unable to do a cash and card combination when splitting a check. Even the manager had to come over to let us know they couldn't figure it out. The food is ok but honestly there are so many better run burger joints in the area with similar or better quality that I would much rather take my business there. I wish it was better but I can't justify patronizing this place any further.

Red Robin is one of my favorite places on earth to eat bad food. I was so excited when we were getting one in our town I couldn't wait for it to open. I even posted a picture of it being built on Facebook. I have now been to this location a few times and the food just doesn't stack up against the other locations I have been to. The quality seems lacking and the service isn't great. Even the French fries were not great and how do you mess that up?

Rarely eat at chain restaurants and will not return to this one.   They HARD SELL you for everything from 'upgrades' to "playing games" on the console that sits on the table.  Even when you tell the server/order-taker to please stop, they don't seem able to.  Silverware was dirty, menu was covered with grease & had to send cold side dishes back.  Trying to pay is a nightmare.  Server quietly admitted that it was frustrating to have to  'teach' people how to use the annoying console, figure a tip & then pay.

I've eaten at a Red Robin only once before, and had a pretty bad experience. I thought that five years was enough time to give this company another chance, and I'm gad I did.  I was really in the mood for a burger, but didn't want to waste my money on the nearby Smashburger.  After perusing the menu for a few minutes, I settled on their burger with the fried egg on top (the secret ingredient that can elevate a burger to levels of transcendence when done properly) and upgraded my fries to the garlic Parmesan for an extra buck.  I also had a Barq's root beer float to wash it all down. The whole meal was perfect.  The garlic fries were so freaking good! and the fact that they offer complimentary refills made the upgrade totally worth it. The burger itself looked amazing, as you can see in the attached picture. That egg was perfectly runny, and the burger was seasoned well, juicy, and just so tasty.  This was honestly the best burger I've had in months, and I really did not expect it from such an unassuming burger joint.  I will definitely be back to chase that perfect burger again, and will definitely splurge on that garlic Parmesan upgrade on the fries.  As a side note, the little table-top tablet thing that you can use to pay for your bill also offers some games, but be warned that they charge you to play! Make sure you read the terms and conditions before you agree to a silly charge just because you were playing around with that thing. It's not worth it at all.

I ordered the Charred on Bleu. I must say, you don't expect much when you pull up to Red Robbins at 10 o'clock on a Saturday night. Well let me tell you, the service was exceptional and the food was delightful. Warm, fresh, and of course, delicious. I highly recommend.

This place was VERY disappointing. The menu is huge, but I can make a burger ten times better than red robin in my own back yard. If you want to order a side, get fries. The salads and veggies are old and gross. Burgers are over priced. So are drinks.  The only highlight of the night was our waitress, I wish I could remember her name. She was great. Too bad the wait staff might be out of jobs soon since you can order your food electronically at your table....
Nothing special. We won't be going back. The fries are mediocre .That being said the restaurant is kept spotless , as are the bathrooms.

Burgers here r really yummy ! And the fries r delicious, good prices and the wait staff is pretty good.  Everytime we go, it is always busy.  I don't drink so I'm not sure if they serve anything but beer and wine.

Seriously, don't eat here. Ordered the Angus Beef Burger...there was no way what we had was Angus anything. Wife had fish and chips, horrible, loaded with tiny bones...Onion rings were good, soup was salty like eating a salt bag.  Water to drink, bill was 60.00 it was ridiculous. The place was filthy, garbage all over the floor and our waitress never came to take our order, and after that all she managed to do was bring us water. Didn't even bring us the box to take home the side salad in. NEVER again...Oh and lastly, if you like your burger rare or medium rare FORGET IT, its not their policy and they are really snippy about letting you know it. We should have walked out. Will be in touch with Amex about this one. Disgusting...
One of the best chain restaurants in the Brick area. Staff is always friendly and they will customize any meal to your liking.

I'm gonna start out by saying this place was unbelievable. The atmosphere is so cute and friendly and they serve beer! Every bite of my burger was so satisfying and delicious!!! The fries were incredible! The "special sauces" they offer are so great. I order a side of there bacon sauce. It had slices of bacon in the sauce!!!!  I am going back as much as I can! And text time I'm trying there milkshakes. 5 stars for sure

I love this place. The service is always great and the food is awesome. They have so many choices of burgers that I almost feel overwhelmed when I'm looking at the menu! My favorite is the banzai, I highly recommend it. They even have alcoholic milkshakes! There is also a rewards program and after every couple burgers or entrees you get a free one! This is a well deserved five star rating.

I honestly don't know why there are so many reviews hating on this place. I'm a tough critic for the most part, and sure this restaurant isn't perfect, but for what you pay and what you get, I have to give them 4 stars. I've been to this location a few times since they've opened, but not regularly. Frankly, the steak fries they offer aren't my cup of tea. But the burgers are always good. Sure they don't cook it "rare, medium, or well" as you ask but you either get it pink or not pink. I don't know any restaurants in this area that actually cook a burger how you want even if they ask you how you want it. Here at least they're honest and you get it either pink or no pink.  Anyway, the latest trip here we ordered the Red Robin gourmet burger, a bacon cheeseburger, and a smoke and pepper burger (I think) and nachos. Everything was tasty and satisfying, still warm and crispy (fries). And we had it TO GO!   I did order a raspberry iced tea though and it tasted like a bag of syrup but it wasn't a deal breaker.  I do usually get the burger with the egg on it but didn't this time. The gourmet cheeseburger was the best burger around (yes, even compared to smashburger right next door which I think is totally overrated).  Anyway, if you like burgers, definitely try this place. I don't understand why people are so angry in the the reviews. Also, they serve alcohol. There's no other good burger place around that does that.

It was guy's day out and my sons and I were going to a car show in Toms River. When I asked them where they wanted to eat they wanted "Red Robin....yummmmm". So off we went. There was plenty of parking and the waiting area was clean. We waited about 10 minutes to get a table.....in an almost empty restaurant. It was weird. But we were seated and our waitress was awesome. They have burgers starting at 7 bucks, which is a bit of a scam because the waitress said they are kid sized. So that 7 dollar burger becomes 9 dollars when you get the "Big", adult size. Also, it was supposed to be a double burger but they must have forgotten the second patty because there was only one....on each of our burgers. It was our first time there so we didn't realize it until after we left and were on our way to the show. Oh, how we laughed.... The best part of the meal was bottomless fries. The fries were good....but we had to stay on top of them to honor that bottomless claim. Bottomless fries should never run empty. Ever. Yummmmm. You can get a burger from 7 bucks on up and the food was pretty good in all fairness though it would have been nice to get 2 patties on our doubles. Lets chock that up to a new cook in the kitchen. The place was clean and the service on point. Even the bathrooms were clean. So if you're hungry and want a decent burger, swing on by. Its not a big, juicy burger like you'd get in a regular burger joint or steak house, but it isn't bad. Oh.....and bottomless fries......yummmmmm.

First time there and last.   Mediocre food.  Too over priced.   Atmosphere was nice and waitress friendly but $30 for a cheeseburger and grilled chicken sandwich?!  Ridiculous.  No wonder the restaurant was empty.

This Red Robin really sucks compared to the other ones and it's all poor service. The waitress waited 30 min to see if we " needed anything." I NEED the fucking fries, like I said already when the food came out. Endless fries! Get your fat ass back here every ten minutes with more fucking fries until I say stop. At least the food tasted fresh this time. This place has been poor from day one with service. They need to overhaul the management now. And fire that damn girl with the blue hair.

I love Red Robin- and this location does not disappoint. This restaurant is clean, staff are kind and attentive, and parking is never an issue. Recently visited early on a weeknight around 5pm- and had no issue with seating or great service.  Recommendations-- Onion Ring Tower is a must!! I always ask for extra campfire sauce as its perfect to dip in fries --If paying with a card, Pay via the online tablet on the table. Totally speeds on a typically lengthy process with receipt signing and so on.  --Ask for fried first with your meal, basically a free Appetizer as they will bring your fries out right after you order while you wait for your burger. Benefit of bottomless sides!!

They cater to you and are ready to please to make your meal a good one. I have to eat Gluten Free so they made sure my food was safe and the people that were cooking it (I was told) would wear gloves. I was happy with the meal and the burger was pretty good with the gluten free bun. We will go back. (My daughter had the same order as I did and she was happy with them too.) Fries were the larger steak fries and were seasoned and good too.
